page.title: 12BIBURY TROUT FARM
page.content: This was founded in 1902 to raise rainbow trout. Each year 250,000- 400,000 live fish are delivered to restock waterways all over Britain. The trout farm employs 12 people who use a variety of machinery of which the most important are pumps to keep the fish healthy. The fish are fed 5 tons of specialised food daily , ( costing Â£450 per ton in 1985 ). There are 50 ponds each containing between 2000-4000 fish. The most critical time is during the breeding season (November-January) when the small trout are more likely to die. Disease can be a problem because of the high stocking rates. About 60,000 people visit the farm each year and a new building will provide an information centre and a place for preparing the fish sold locally and to the visitors.
